job description:
Position Description
In this role you will conduct interdisciplinary research on (1) clear, credible, and verifiable analyses of manufacturing technologies and systems, with an emphasis on manufacturing competitiveness, costs and productivity, life cycle environmental impacts, and cross-sectoral and supply chain impacts; and (2) modeling and analysis of energy technologies and systems encompassing both supply-side and demand-side transformations towards an economically sustainable and low-emissions energy future. You will also:
  • Develop strategic insights and/or guidance for various project stakeholders on manufacturing and energy technology R&D and policy.
  • Communicate the outcomes of the research through internal and public reports, peer-reviewed publications, and scientific conferences.
  • Develop simulation, optimization, techno-economic, and life cycle models of manufacturing and energy technologies and systems.
  • Conduct rigorous analyses to assess the functional, economic, and environmental performance of conventional and next-generation technology systems in the industrial and energy sectors. This includes robust uncertainty quantification and statistical analysis.
  • Prepare scientific and technical reports, peer-reviewed journal articles, and conference papers to communicate and disseminate the research results and methodologies.
  • Assist in project coordination, management, and communication activities in a multidisciplinary team of researchers from various national laboratories and industry partners.
The candidate is expected to have a strong engineering background with demonstrated experience in systems-level thinking that draws from several scientific disciplines.

Position Requirements

Knowledge, Skills and Experience
  • Experience developing mathematical or computational models for simulation and optimization of energy systems.
  • Experience conducting life cycle assessments and techno-economic analyses of energy and industrial technologies.
  • Knowledge of conventional and next-generation manufacturing technologies, and their environmental impacts including energy use, water use, and emissions.
  • Strong command of engineering fundamentals and sound general scientific knowledge, particularly as it relates to the emerging interdisciplinary field of sustainability science.
  • Experience working in multidisciplinary research environments.Ability to participate and/or interface with experimental R&D groups to collect suitable datasets to develop or calibrate models.
  • Knowledge of DOE Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy (EERE) research programs and strategic plans, particularly in the areas of advanced manufacturing.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.Experience writing successful grant proposals.
  • Ability to think strategically and use independent judgment.
  • Experience developing tools and data sets for public use.
  • Ability to synthesize effective data visualizations to communicate results from complex data analyses. Developing evidence-based policy insights in science and technology.
  • PhD in mechanical or industrial engineering.
  • Research experience working on environmental sustainability problems in the context of engineering technology systems.
  • Postdoctoral experience required.
